snippet: Financing for an increase to $2 billion a year will come from restructuring the $2.4 billion E-Rate program.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission will double amount of money it devotes to adding high-speed Internet connections in schools and libraries over next two years in effort to meet Pres Obama's promise to provide broadband service for an estimated 20 million American students in 15,000 schools.
lead_paragraph: Financing for an increase to $2 billion a year will come from restructuring the $2.4 billion E-Rate program.

headline.main: F.C.C. Says It Will Double Spending on High-Speed Internet in Schools and Libraries
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Says It Will Double Spending on High-Speed Internet in Schools and Libraries
